execution_summary.reason_for_partial: Time and token budget constraints. Core cross-references and critical alignments applied. Remaining edits are lower priority ADD_REFERENCE and detailed REMOVE_REDUNDANCY edits that can be applied in a follow-up pass.
execution_summary.blocking_issues_encountered: 3 edits blocked pending Tier 1 approval for tick-based timing storage (SPEC017)

blocking_issues.title: Tick-Based Timing Requires Tier 1 Approval
blocking_issues.description: SPEC017 proposes tick-based timing (INTEGER ticks) instead of REAL seconds in database. This is a schema change requiring Tier 1 approval.
blocking_issues.recommendation: Defer edits referencing tick storage format until Tier 1 approval obtained for SPEC017

Added reference to SPEC016 Mixer specification range [DBD-MIX-010] through [DBD-MIX-052]
Added SPEC016 Output references with ring buffer parameters

documents_edited.notes: Applied critical header deprecation notices and key parameter references. Remaining 14 edits are ADD_REFERENCE and detailed content edits that can be applied in follow-up pass.

Not attempted due to time/token constraints. SPEC014 has most contradictions with SPEC016 and requires extensive REMOVE_REDUNDANCY and ALIGN_WITH_NEW_DESIGN edits. Recommended for dedicated follow-up pass.

implementation_impact_summary.notes: All edits applied are documentation-only cross-references and clarifications. No implementation changes required.

tier_1_approval_needed.impact: Database schema change: passages table timing fields from REAL seconds to INTEGER ticks
tier_1_approval_needed.rationale: Eliminates floating-point rounding errors, provides nanosecond precision, aligns with SPEC017 design
